http://www.inemi.org/project-page/pb-free-component-board-finish-reliability Research Assistant Arizona State University August 2006  –  August 2010  (4 years 1 month) Growth of InGaN/GaN multiple quantum wells(MQWs) with their application in light emitting diode(LED): 
* Successfully grew InGaN/GaN MQWs with violet, blue and green emission using MOCVD. 
* Characterized the optical properties of InGaN/GaN MQWs using photoluminescence and optimized the growth condition accordingly. 
* Maintained MOCVD reactor and safety procedures; provided training to new users.  
 
Investigation of the microstructure of InGaN/GaN MQWs: 
* Utilized laboratory instruments (XRD, TEM/STEM, EELS/EDX, etc) and obtained results on such materials aspects as crystal structure, chemical composition, defect, interface coherency and elemental distribution in nanoscale. 
* Used cryo holder and Gatan SmartSet Controller to cool samples down to liquid nitrogen temperature to minimize electron beam damages.  
* Performed simulation to calculate the stress distribution within the MQW structure. 
 
Study of the mechanism for optical degradation of InGaN thin film: 
* Optically pumped InGaN films using LAMBDA KrF excimer laser. 
* Comparatively investigated the original and degraded sample with various TEM/STEM techniques, including BF, WBDF, SAD, CBED, HRTEM, HAADF, Z-contrast images.
